name: sfchronicle
text:
Washington's NFL team is officially changing its name. 

See, it wasn't that hard, writes @annkillion. Even when forced by interests of greed rather than righteousness, change can be made. https://t.co/WCJhvH5u9t

text: The need for COVID-19 drugs will not evaporate once vaccines are available. https://t.co/bo6luTrKB4

text: With statues of controversial historical figures coming down in S.F., @TonyBravoSF has ideas for how to replace them ‚Äî and honor local pop culture and people of color: https://t.co/xML0UT7s5Y

name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text: Sierra County DA charges 40-year-old wanted felon with murdering Danville doctor over the Fourth of July weekend while the father was off-roading with his teenage son. Among the 9 charges: murder, attempted murder and burglarizing gold mine. via @MGafni: https://t.co/Q8K24KEbqP https://t.co/ooLWVOfxP0

name: sfchronicle
text: What if you took two blocks of office towers in the Financial District, closed off traffic between them and turned the street into a park?  Introducing the micro-hood: https://t.co/iMgW4ZRXcQ

name: sfchronicle
text: Companies are already mulling how to incorporate social distancing and new cleanliness protocols into their offices. But architects Elizabeth Ranieri and Byron Kuth are thinking bigger by exploring the idea of micro-hoods: https://t.co/yQiDPZOI6f

text:
"Honestly, I have no interest in knowing American cuisine."

Soleil Ho (@Hooleil) talks with Hawa Hassan, CEO of Basbaas Somali Foods, about her work to promote African cuisines in the U.S. and her new cookbook, ‚ÄúIn Bibi‚Äôs Kitchen.‚Äù

name: sfchronicle
text: Grant Imahara, an electrical engineer and former ‚ÄúMythbusters‚Äù host, dies at 49, media reports say. https://t.co/HM7jk6aIN0

name: sfchronicle
text: Orange County's Board of Education reportedly votes 4-1 on Monday night to allow schools to reopen next month for in-person instruction without requiring masks or social distancing. Individual schools in the county, however, are not bound to the decision. https://t.co/7cvltBJNb7

name: sfchronicle
text: More on the death of Grant Imahara: https://t.co/1bT8dmzi8q https://t.co/s9hzmXR1j9

name: sfchronicle
text:
Shahid Buttar, the democratic socialist challenging Nancy Pelosi, is trying to convince her to debate him. It‚Äôs an uphill battle. Pelosi hasn‚Äôt debated an opponent in 33 years.

Story by @JoeGarofoli: https://t.co/FzmcIEoPjB https://t.co/JAZdgXZbcY

name: sfchronicle
text: Will your Bay Area school be online, in-person or both? Here's a glance at some districts' plans for the fall. https://t.co/xQkb14j4Nb https://t.co/wa06ESrjsy

name: sfchronicle
text: Parents and teachers are anxious and upset about the way plans for reopening schools in the fall are still up in the air. @jilltucker talks about the latest in an unstable situation. Listen to our Fifth & Mission podcast: https://t.co/6cPP0qqHjp

name: sfchronicle
text: Politicians and public health leaders have committed to equitably sharing any vaccine that works, but an initiative to make that happen may allow rich countries to build their stockpiles and leave fewer doses for the poor, the Associated Press reports.  https://t.co/M2zMOyFrss https://t.co/61dyFcnn2X

name: sfchronicle
text: A new White House-backed ad campaign aims to encourage people who are unemployed or unhappy in their jobs or careers to go out and ‚Äúfind something new.‚Äù  https://t.co/E796GDAuYP https://t.co/HD5hK94s73

name: sfchronicle
text: ‚ÄúThere are two different camps,‚Äù said City Councilman Loren Taylor. ‚ÄúOne is, ‚ÄòLet‚Äôs just pull away funds right now, and it will work itself out.‚Äô And the other is, ‚ÄòLet‚Äôs be more deliberate and have a plan before we take away those funds.‚Äô‚Äù https://t.co/KLW0fvz5b0

name: sfchronicle
text: With the end of summer break just weeks away and coronavirus cases surging statewide, Bay Area school districts are racing to cement their plans and advise families if, when or how their campuses will reopen to students. https://t.co/vOEGHcySNj

name: sfchronicle
text: Here‚Äôs one of the most radical visions for rethinking downtown S.F. out there. https://t.co/7i9b2GSrKH

name: sfchronicle
text: Adm. Brett Giroir, a key member of the White House coronavirus task force, voiced optimism Tuesday that some coronavirus indicators are improving nationwide, like hospitalizations and ventilator use, and cases leveling off in some places.  https://t.co/P6cUIhH3kF https://t.co/CXgip9mLnv

name: sfchronicle
text: If House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is worried, she doesn‚Äôt show it. https://t.co/GocRoc8RuR

name: sfchronicle
text: Oakland police announce a sudden increase in killings as the City Council is set to discuss possible cuts on July 21, weeks after passing a budget that stripped $14.3 million from the department. https://t.co/jkAH5D5yS7

name: sfchronicle
text: Two San Francisco libraries will open for curbside pickup in early August. Why has the small reopening taken so long? Because librarians have been tapped as the backbone of the city‚Äôs disaster response. https://t.co/uVhqMJFeIp

name: sfchronicle
text: The San Francisco Public Library is most residents‚Äô favorite city department, according to surveys. https://t.co/lAN3DDrFfK

name: sfchronicle
text: The world now has recorded more than 13.1 million coronavirus cases as the indidious virus continues its global march, with a death toll of more than 574,000 individuals, according to data collected by Johns Hopkins University researchers. https://t.co/UgktXiqwmd https://t.co/qV7nieEXMb

name: sfchronicle
text: In November, for the first time in her 33-year congressional career, Nancy Pelosi will be challenged for her San Francisco seat in a general election by a fellow Democrat, who calls her insufficiently progressive. https://t.co/ot7NKRpEza

name: sfchronicle
text: Officials in the Australian state of Queensland said anyone caught violating coronavirus quarantines could face up to six months in jail. https://t.co/WP6b4zYxh4 https://t.co/4RC2h3CTUZ

name: sfchronicle
text: San Francisco saw another 50 new cases of the coronavirus, officials reported Tuesday, bringing its total so far to 4,640. San Mateo County added 123 new cases, for a total of 4,168 coronavirus cases recorded to date. https://t.co/cr8yjQSFvS https://t.co/BfHwNT0udu

name: sfchronicle
text:
Total cases:
‚Ä¢ 335,487 in California, including 7,100 deaths. 
‚Ä¢ 36,640 in the Bay Area, including 658 deaths.
‚Ä¢ More than 3.3 million in the U.S., including 135,802 deaths. 
‚Ä¢ More than 13.1 million in the world, with more than 574,000 deaths.
